title: Skillet Salsa Shrimp With Spinach and Feta
name: With Spinach and Feta
description: A 15-minute seafood spread is in your future with this decadent recipe. Your favorite jar of salsa quickly turns into the base for a shrimp, spinach, and cheese-packed dinner. Just serve with a side of chips or flatbread for the ultimate meal.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: To make garlic lemon shrimp with spinach and feta flatbread, heat olive oil, sauté garlic and lemon zest. Add salsa, tomato sauce, cook until thickened. Add shrimp, cook until pink. Stir in spinach until wilted. Serve over flatbread, topped with feta.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: Heat olive oil, garlic, and lemon zest in a large skillet on medium until beginning to brown, about 1 min.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Add salsa and tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Nestle shrimp in the salsa mixture and cook, covered, 3 min.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Fold in spinach and cook until beginning to wilt and shrimp are opaque throughout, 1 to 2 min. more.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Sprinkle with feta and serve with flatbread if desired.

title: Seared Tilapia With Spiralized Zucchini
name: With Spiralized Zucchini
description: Amp up spiralized zucchini with briny capers, fresh parsley, and bright lemon in this delicious summertime meal. For under 300 calories a plate, it’s a family favorite you’ll make again and again.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: The ingredients for the tilapia and zucchini dish: 1 1/2 lb. zucchini, 3 Tbsp. olive oil (divided), kosher salt, pepper, 4 small fillets tilapia (about 1 1/2 lbs.), 1 lemon (thinly sliced and seeded), 2 cloves garlic (thinly sliced), 1 Tbsp. capers, and 1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley (chopped).

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: Heat oven to 475°F. Line large rimmed baking sheet with reusable baking mat or parchment paper. Using spiralizer, spiralize zucchini, or slice zucchini into thin ribbons.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Transfer zucchini to prepared baking sheet; toss with 1 tbsp. oil and 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper. Roast 15 min. Increase heat to broil and continue to cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 min.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp. oil in large cast-iron skillet on medium-high. Season fish with 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper and cook until just opaque throughout, 2 to 3 min. per side. Transfer to plates.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Add remaining tbsp. oil to skillet along with lemon, garlic, and capers and cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic is golden brown and tender. Toss with parsley, then spoon over tilapia and serve with zucchini.

title: Striped Bass With Radish Salsa Verde
name: Radish Salsa Verde
description: A piece of beautiful bass is already a showstopping dinner, but top it with a herby salsa verde that combines crisp radishes and salty anchovy paste for a true culinary delight.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: The ingredients for the recipe: one small clove of garlic, pressed; one tablespoon of anchovy paste (or three finely chopped anchovy fillets); half a small red onion, finely chopped; one tablespoon of red wine vinegar; half a cup plus one tablespoon of olive oil, divided; one bunch of radishes, diced with leaves separated and finely chopped; one cup of finely chopped flat-leaf parsley leaves; one teaspoon of finely chopped tarragon leaves; four 6-ounce fillets of striped bass; and kosher salt and pepper to taste.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: In medium bowl, whisk together garlic, anchovy paste, onion, and vinegar and let sit 5 min.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Stir in 1/2 cup oil, then radishes, radish greens, parsley, and tarragon.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Heat remaining tbsp. oil in medium skillet on medium. Pat fish dry and season with 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper. Cook, skin side down, until skin is crisp and golden brown, about 6 min. Flip and cook until fish is just opaque throughout, 2 to 4 min. more. Serve topped with radish salsa verde.

title: Spicy Tofu Tacos
name: Mike Garten
description: Crumble up tofu with the heat of poblano peppers, chile, and garlic, and you get a healthy version of spicy tacos at only 230 calories per serving. Add with a delicious slaw or side salad for the perfect dinnertime plate.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: The ingredients for the recipe: one package of extra-firm tofu; half of a small poblano pepper; half of a red pepper; two cloves of garlic; one small onion; one tablespoon of oil; one and a half teaspoons of chili powder; half a teaspoon of ground coriander; a quarter teaspoon each of salt and pepper; eight corn tortillas; shredded romaine lettuce; and one jalapeño, sliced.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: In a food processor, finely chop poblano pepper, red pepper, garlic, and onion.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Cook mixture in a large nonstick skillet in oil, stirring occasionally, for four minutes.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Crumble tofu (squeezed of excess moisture) into the skillet and season with chili powder, ground coriander, salt, and pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Spoon into tortillas; top with lettuce and jalapeños.

title: Shrimp Egg Salad
name: Mike Getty
description: Salad is a deceptive name for this hearty dinner, which fills your belly with three of our favorite ingredients—shrimp, hard-boiled eggs, and creamy avocado, all topped with a tasty lime dressing.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: The ingredients for the recipe: a quarter of a small red onion, thinly sliced; two tablespoons of fresh lime juice; one tablespoon of olive oil; twelve ounces of large peeled and deveined shrimp; kosher salt and pepper; one cup of grape tomatoes, halved; eight cups of butter lettuce; half a cup of fresh cilantro leaves; half of an avocado, diced; and two hard-boiled eggs, cut into pieces.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: In a large bowl, toss onion with lime juice and ½ tablespoon oil and let sit for 5 minutes.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Heat  1/2 tablespoon oil in a large skillet on medium high. Season shrimp with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper and cook until opaque throughout, 2 to 3 minutes per side.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Toss tomatoes with onions, then toss with lettuce and cilantro.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Divide among bowls and top with shrimp, avocado and egg.

title: Spiced Grilled Eggplant With Tomato Salad
name: With Tomato Salad
description: This tangy eggplant dish should be the star of your plate the next time you grill. Pair it with a wild rice salad and a lean protein for a complete—and completely filling—meal.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: Two medium eggplants (about 1 lb each), sliced lengthwise 1⁄2 inch thick; four tablespoons of olive oil; one teaspoon of ground coriander; one teaspoon of cayenne; kosher salt; two tablespoons of fresh lemon juice; two tablespoons of red wine vinegar; one and a half cups of multicolored cherry or grape tomatoes, halved; two small Fresno chiles or other hot chiles, finely chopped; a quarter cup of packed fresh mint leaves, finely chopped (plus more for serving); a quarter cup of low-fat Greek yogurt; and two tablespoons of low-fat milk.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: Heat grill to medium. Brush eggplant with 3 Tbsp oil, then season with coriander, cayenne, and 1⁄4 tsp salt. Grill until tender, 10 to 12 minutes.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, remaining Tbsp oil, and 1⁄2 tsp salt; fold in tomatoes, chiles, and mint.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Arrange eggplant on a large platter; top with tomato salad. Whisk together yogurt and milk and drizzle over vegetables.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Sprinkle with mint leaves if desired.

title: Pan-Roasted Bass With Papaya Relish
name: With Papaya Relish
description: Switch up your usual seafood (we see you, salmon) by grilling up this delicious bass, which gets a surprising kick of tropical flavor from diced papaya. Serve with a side of coconut rice for a delicious plate that’s reminiscent of an island vacation.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: Two scallions; two tablespoons plus one teaspoon of olive oil; one tablespoon of lime juice; one teaspoon of honey; kosher salt; one jalapeño, thinly sliced; four 6-oz fillets of striped bass; one cup of diced papaya (about one small papaya); and one avocado, diced.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: Heat broiler. Place scallions on a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle with 1 tsp oil, and broil until charred, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board, let cool, then thinly slice.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: In a large bowl, whisk together lime juice, honey, and 1⁄4 tsp salt. Stir in jalapeño and scallions.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Heat remaining 2Tbsp oil in a medium skillet on medium. Pat fish dry, season with 1⁄2 tsp each salt and pepper, and cook, skin side down, until skin is golden brown and crisp, 6 to 7 minutes. Flip and cook until fish is opaque throughout, 3 to 5 minutes more. Transfer to a platter.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Fold papaya and avocado into jalapeño mixture and spoon over fish.

title: Peach and Cucumber Salad
name: Salad
description: This fruity dish combines sweet peaches with cucumbers and fresh herbs that make this the perfect salad. Add pieces of chicken to up the protein for a more filling dinner, and you’ve got yourself an easy-to-make, low-cal meal.

comments.name: Ingredients
comments.comment: Two tablespoons of olive oil; one tablespoon of white wine vinegar; a quarter teaspoon each of kosher salt and pepper; one small shallot; half of a small red chili; two ripe peaches or nectarines; one Kirby cucumber; a quarter cup of basil; and a quarter cup of mint.

comments.name: Step 1
comments.comment: In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.

comments.name: Step 2
comments.comment: Stir in shallot and red chile, both thinly sliced.

comments.name: Step 3
comments.comment: Cut peaches or nectarines into half-inch thick wedges and add them into the bowl. Let them sit and toss occasionally for five minutes.

comments.name: Step 4
comments.comment: Use a vegetable peeler to cut a Kirby cucumber into long, thin stripsFold the cucumbers into peaches along with fresh basil and torn fresh mint.
